attributes.action: Investigate violation of Criminal Justice Act 1988 on HK Police
attributes.additional_details:
During HK Umbrella Revolution, We believed HK Police had violated the Human Rights Law and Criminal Justice Act 1988. One example is the police inappropriate using of British made tear-gas and pepper sprays on 928 protest.

We demand the following:
1. Termination of Training and Exchange programs of HK Police with UK Police Depts & Scotland Yard, but no restriction on fighting crimes co-operations thru Interpol.
2. Investigation and custody on involved HK Policemen, especially who holds British & HK Dual-citizenships police officers if evidences proven the violation of the CJA 1988, This restriction does not affect their right to land in Britain and Commonwealth's Lands.

rejection.details: This is a police operational matter.
